title: If I'm on a home network and on my own wifi, but have connected to my school's wifi before, can my school see what I do online? - Quora

response.answer_text: I asked my teacher the same exact question. She said no, it is not possible, unless you use a device purchased by the school. Now, if your device has Device Policy or Spyware from your school, that is a different story. If you got your device from school (school paid for it), the school will most likely be able to see what you are doing. If it is your personal device (you bought with your own money), they will not be able to install spyware or device policy without your permission, and if they do with your permission on your personal device, they will not tell you/punish you, because well, it is your device.

No... but if you are watching porn or something the school should have some kind of site blocker to prevent that from happening. If they dont have assigned ips or sign in with a name and password all is good as every time you register as guess you get a different ip on the network.
